primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The transformation of a disabled man by the power of the Gospel, serving as a 'notable sign' that the old regime of Empire has been defeated by Easter life.

tekstueel_bewijs: this holy transformation is not performed by Jesus. It is performed by the church
The real witness of Peter and John is when they say to the man: 'In the name of Jesus... stand up and walk.'
a notable sign has been done through them
the move toward the new future given by the spirit

zender.identificatie: The Holy Spirit / The 'Messianic possibility of God'
tekstueel_bewijs: the Holy Spirit is not confined to the exclusionary ways of the empire

ontvanger.identificatie: The Lame Man / The Hearer (as 'candidates to be that man')
tekstueel_bewijs: He is the one addressed and summoned by the Easter Church.
we become candidates to be that man
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

helper.identificatie: The Name of Jesus / The Spirit
tekstueel_bewijs: by faith in his name, his name itself has made this man strong
helper.rol_van_god: Is God Subject, Helper, or absent?

tekstueel_bewijs: the empire has a vested interest in keeping folks disabled
the empire of military capitalism in which we live
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is primarily systemic and political rather than ontological (sin/death) or personal (Satan).

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The ethical/political response of the crowd and the church to the 'notable sign'.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.object: Political engagement and defiance of the status quo
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The healing (Program 1) creates the 'small door' through which the ethical response (Program 2) becomes possible.

actantieel_schema_visualisatie.zender_naar_ontvanger: Holy Spirit → New Life/Transformation → The Lame Man/Hearer
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.helper_subject_tegenstander: Name of Jesus → The Church/Apostles ← The Empire
actantieel_schema_visualisatie.subject_naar_object: The Church → Performance of Transformative Energy

voorbeelden_mens_subject: It is performed by the church
The witness is about the walk to newness

voorbeelden: The apostles... must play it all by ear
invited to decide, to opt for the time of refreshment
The work of 'witnesses' is to tell about a world other than the one that is everywhere accepted.
immediately transformed by the word of the gospel

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on the 'will' and 'decision' of the hearer to opt out of empire and into the 'Easter life'.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Empire) through ~S1 (Collusion) to ~S2 (The Sign) and finally S1 (Refreshing).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the 'performance' of the church which breaks the stagnation of empire.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: S2 is taken very seriously as a political reality, but less so as a spiritual/ontological reality (sin).

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses the language of 'Easter power,' the primary actant of the transformation is the Church/Witness, making it structurally anthropocentric despite theocentric vocabulary.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: this holy transformation is not performed by Jesus. It is performed by the church

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: The Apostles are models of 'daring witnesses' and the Lame Man is a model for the hearer's potential transformation.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focusing on Christ as the one who heals through his own authority, rather than the Church's performance.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism; the resurrection is validated by human social action.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is narratively tight but logically strained by the claim that the Church, not Jesus, performs the transformation.
spanning_punten: The claim that Jesus is 'in, with, and under' vs the claim that the Church 'performs' the act.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: the old regime has been defeated and no longer governs

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides the 'rush of energy' for the human subject to act.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is defined as 'collusion with empire' or 'stagnation' rather than a condition requiring a Savior.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully politicizes the text but risks moralism by making the Church the Subject of the active verbs of transformation.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The Church is the subject of 'performing' the transformation.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make the Risen Christ the Subject who uses the Church as a vessel.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'transformation is performed by the church,' use 'The Risen Christ continues his work through the hands of his church.'

identificatie_herstel.voorgestelde_identificatie: Hearer as 'Receiver' of a gift they cannot produce.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the lameness/inability of the man before the word is spoken.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on how the Spirit grants the 'ability' to walk, rather than the 'decision' to vote against empire.

tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Connect the 'stagnation' of empire to the 'stagnation' of death and sin.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To make the 'Easter Power' more than just social activism.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Healing as a pure gift of God, which then creates the freedom for the witness of defiance.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon has a powerful rhetorical grip and a strong social conscience, but it needs to ground the 'performance' of the church more deeply in the primary agency of the Risen Christ to avoid becoming a new law of 'Easter activism'.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the sermon is brilliant (Ecce Homo motif); semiotically, it reveals a shift in agency from God to the Church.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes the 'Name of Jesus' as the cause; Greimas analysis shows the preacher attributes the 'performance' to the Church.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Empire' functions as a narrative Opponent that defines the Subject's competence.

volledige_subject_lijst: The apostles play it by ear
appendices.notities: The use of 'Ecce Homo' for the lame man is a bold semiotic substitution.
